description: User asks PropScout AI to confirm whether a specific Tampa property is in an HOA that allows rentals; the assistant retrieves the MLS listing, extracts HOA rental policy, and provides a clear answer.

messages.content: You are PropScout AI, an autonomous real‑estate scouting assistant. Use the available tools to answer user queries about properties, zoning, schools, ROI, and scheduling. Return concise, helpful responses.
Can you verify if the property at 1234 Riverfront Drive in Tampa is located within an HOA that permits rentals?
Sure, let me pull the MLS listing for that address and check the HOA details.

[{"address":"1234 Riverfront Drive, Tampa, FL 33602","price":425000,"bedrooms":3,"bathrooms":2,"size_sqft":1800,"url":"https://example-mls.com/listing/1234riverfront","hoa_fee":250,"hoa_rules":"Rental restriction: minimum 12‑month lease allowed; short‑term rentals (Airbnb) prohibited; permits long‑term rentals after board approval"}]

I’ve found the MLS listing for 1234 Riverfront Drive. The property is part of an HOA that charges a $250 monthly fee. According to the HOA rules, long‑term rentals (minimum 12‑month lease) are allowed after board approval, but short‑term rentals such as Airbnb are prohibited. So the HOA does permit rentals, provided you meet the board’s approval process and adhere to the 12‑month minimum lease requirement.
